channel.title: Comments on: The Desire to Lose

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Wow.... that was just sublime... I noticed that the book is out of print. I'm guessing you have a copy of it? xD Definitely would be interested in reading it if I could find a copy.
item.content:encoded: Wow…. that was just sublime… I noticed that the book is out of print. I’m guessing you have a copy of it? xD Definitely would be interested in reading it if I could find a copy.

item.title: By: Zoltan Halasz
item.dc:creator: Zoltan Halasz
item.content:encoded:
I agree with the revelation about losing a game since I read that part of The Empty Board which titled “Partners vs. Opponents”.
These were the magic words for me: “You must play well, not just so that you may win, but so that you can enjoy the game. When I try something in a game, not knowing just where it will lead, I don’t want my partner to just collapse. I want the other player to come up with a challenging response that will push us both to higher levels of play. That is our common goal, to reach higher levels of play, not just to win games.”
Have a nice day! ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I see the validity in that. Some of my memorable lessons involve realizing how my "winning" strategy was actually quite flawed. Haha.
item.content:encoded: I see the validity in that. Some of my memorable lessons involve realizing how my “winning” strategy was actually quite flawed. Haha.

item.title: By: Nate Eagle
item.dc:creator: Nate Eagle
item.description: I don't know - personally, I find that there are still TONS of lessons to take from games in which I won. There's no lack of mistakes. But it's a little easier for me to take the brutality of the review if I know that at least I won. Maybe it's my fragile ego, but I find that for me it's the better way to go.
item.content:encoded: I don’t know – personally, I find that there are still TONS of lessons to take from games in which I won. There’s no lack of mistakes. But it’s a little easier for me to take the brutality of the review if I know that at least I won. Maybe it’s my fragile ego, but I find that for me it’s the better way to go.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Hear hear. I'm hoping to get to a point where I'm more excited to get a game (that I lost) reviewed than one that I won. =D
item.content:encoded: Hear hear. I’m hoping to get to a point where I’m more excited to get a game (that I lost) reviewed than one that I won. =D
